channel.title: Data Analysis on
channel.description: Recent content in Data Analysis on

item.title: How to Update 2
item.description: Problems updating npm packages # Delete the ./node_modules folder, and run again: npm install Problems with cache # Delete the temporary directories: npm run clean

item.title: How to add images
item.description: When writing docs under Doks theme the images were strictly organized under page bundle. ├── blog/ │ ├── say-hello-to-doks/ │ │ ├── index.md │ │ └── say-hello-to-doks.png │ └── _index.md └── _index.md If you want to refer to images not following the above structure, you can refer to images in hyperlink [asf](/2022-05-19-18-31-12.png) \![images](/2022-05-19-18-31-12.png) \![images](/images/2022-05-19-18-31-14.png) and will get: asf !images !images Or you can place images using html code:
